result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary R. Nicholson

defendant.name: Nicholson, Zachary R.
defendant.address: 11698 Sumach Lake Road, Arbor Bitae, WI 54568

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:34 AM Defendant Zachary R. Nicholson in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Marcy's law not yet applicable to this case.  Defendant still seeking public defender. Advised to continue reaching out to public defender's office.  Defendant in custody on revocation hold.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:28 AM Defendant Zachary R. Nicholson in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms he is looking for a public defender. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

1:41 PM Defendant Zachary R. Nicholson in court, in custody Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF152 and 22CF154.  Defendant confirms receipt of complaint in 22CF154. Rights given. Bond continues in 22CF152, Bond set in 22CF154
No possession of prescription with valid prescription, no use of any device to connect to the internet or utilize social media.

1:40 PM Defendant Zachary R. Nicholson appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant received copy of complaint. Court reads charges. Attorney rights given. State speaks to sentencing. Court authorizes bond at $20,000.00 CASH with conditions: No possession of prescription with valid prescription, no use of any device to connect to the internet or utilize social media. Bond form.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
